title: Thorne Room Videos: Short But Informative Peeks into Three Tiny Rooms
copy: Take a journey into the museum's beloved Thorne Miniature Rooms. They were created by Narcissa Niblack Thorne, who she assembled a group of skilled artisans in Chicago to help construccta series of intricate rooms on the minute scale of 1:12. With these interiors, she wanted to present a visual history of interior design that was both accurate and inspiring. The result is two parts fantasy, one part history, perfect for engaging students.   Japanese Traditional Interior   Learn more about the Japanese Interior below.   Pennsylvania Kitchen, 1752   Learn more about the Pennsylvania Kitchen below.   French Salon of the Louis XIV Period, 1660-1700   Learn more about the French Salon below.   Be sure to check out our Thorne Room Highlights to learn more about these beloved rooms.
